item.title: A Spirit of Unity
item.description: Young Women Class Presidency Meetings Part 1: A Laurel Class Presidency works together to achieve unity as they serve their fellow Young Women.

item.title: So Great a Cause
item.description: Young Women Class Presidency Meetings Part 2: A Laurel Class Presidency plans and carries out ministering service as they strive to be an example to others around them.

item.title: If Ye Are Prepared
item.description: A Laurel learns the importance of preparation as she tries, and tries again, to successfully conduct Young Women opening exercises.

item.title: Welcome to the 2014 Annual Auxiliary Training: Sunday School
item.description: As Sunday School leaders and teachers work to improve learning and teaching in the lives of those they serve, they will become mutually edified as they learn and teach by the Spirit and inspire the learner to live the doctrine.

item.title: Welcome to the 2014 Annual Auxiliary Training: Primary
item.description: As Primary leaders and teachers work to improve learning and teaching in the lives of those they serve, they consider the opportunity they have to not only influence a child, but to learn from a child as they embark on the covenant path.

item.title: Welcome to the 2014 Annual Auxiliary Training: Young Men
item.description: Young men and their leaders work together to improve learning and teaching in their lives, they consider their sacred duty to “warn, expound, exhort, and teach and invite all to come unto Christ,” particularly through the ordinance of the sacrament.

item.title: Welcome to the 2014 Annual Auxiliary Training: Relief Society
item.description: As sisters work together in the Relief Society to improve learning and teaching in their lives, they can become instruments in the hands of the Lord by ministering to others in this great work.

item.title: Welcome to the 2014 Annual Auxiliary Training: Young Women
item.description: As young women and their leaders work together to improve learning and teaching in their lives, they consider ways to learn, live, and share the gospel which prepares them to make and keep sacred covenants and receive temple ordinances.

item.title: Living the Gospel Brings Power
item.description: The most powerful teacher is one that lives the principles of the gospel everyday.

item.title: The Power of Informal Teaching
item.description: Powerful teaching moments can occur in settings that are informal and unplanned.

item.title: We All Need to Be Nurtured
item.description: All who attend church classes and meetings must receive lessons that inspire and allow them to be touched by the spirit and nurtured by the spirit.

item.title: Set in Order Our Own Homes
item.description: Ward council members and auxiliary leaders have the foremost responsibility to live the gospel in their own homes.

item.title: The Ward Council-We're All in This Together
item.description: The successful ward council is a support to the family.

item.title: The Role of Parents
item.description: Parents have the most important role in teaching their children the doctrines of the gospel.

item.title: The Blessings of Participation
item.description: Participation by all class members allows the Holy Ghost to enter into the heart of each learner and teach important principles.

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Home
item.description: The home is a sacred place to learn and teach gospel principles. This informal setting allows daily teaching moments and is focused on meeting the needs of individuals and families.

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Church
item.description: Teaching in Church meetings and classes helps individuals and families learn the doctrine and take the principles into their homes. Effective teachers bear testimony and invite action.

item.title: Focusing on One or Two Principles
item.description: Effective teachers choose to focus on one or two ideas rather than pushing to get through too much material. This allows for greater participation and the bearing of testimonies.

item.title: Lifelong Learning
item.description: Everyone can continue to learn and study gospel principles no matter what their age or experience in the Church.

item.title: We Are One
item.description: As leaders, members, and missionaries, we are one in the work of salvation. Working together, we will find great power to bring others into the Church, to strengthen new members, and to rescue the lost.

item.title: My Work and My Glory
item.description: Our work as leaders, members, and missionaries is to help in the work of salvation—to bless others through our efforts in conversion, retention, and activation.

item.title: Let Your Light So Shine
item.description: A recent convert saw the gospel in action in the lives of a member family and desired those blessings for himself.

item.title: I’ll Go Where You Want Me to Go
item.description: A video presentation portraying member missionary work.

item.title: Equally Yoked Together
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer uses the story of oxen being equally yoked together to teach principles of teamwork.

item.title: Bring Forth Fruit with Patience: The Dysert Family
item.description: A recent convert tells of his conversion and his gratitude for the gospel and the priesthood.

item.title: We Rejoice in Christ
item.description: Members share the gospel as they live it joyfully and invite others to come and participate.

item.title: The Faith of Youth: The Ennis Family
item.description: The Ennis family had become less active, but they responded when ward members reached out in love.

item.title: The Lord of the Harvest: The Adams Family
item.description: A family puts into effect a family mission plan that includes enclosing baptism invitations in their daughter’s birthday party invitations.

item.title: We Are Brothers
item.description: A group of young men reach out to the less-active young men in their ward.

item.title: Sharing the Gospel: Immokalee
item.description: The Young Men organization in a branch grows from one young man attending to 26.

item.title: Missionary Mindset
item.description: Each member can do missionary work in his or her circumstances.

item.title: Because I Have Been Given Much
item.description: A family prays for someone to help, and their daughter is inspired to invite a friend at school to meet with the missionaries.

item.title: Priesthood Duty: Preaching the Gospel
item.description: A young Aaronic Priesthood holder shares the gospel with friends and neighbors through service and testimony.

item.title: Working Together As One
item.description: We strive to follow President Monson’s counsel to work together as members and missionaries.

item.title: Called and Prepared: Youth in the Work of Salvation
item.description: Youth discuss with Elder Neil L. Andersen how they are sharing the gospel in their everyday lives.

item.title: Focused on the Work of Salvation
item.description: Ward councils find success as they focus on the work of salvation both in and out of council meetings.

item.title: Using Priesthood Keys in the Work
item.description: Stake presidents hold keys to lead missionary work; mission presidents hold keys for convert baptisms and the full-time missionaries. These leaders serve together in the work of salvation.

item.title: New and Returning Member Progress - Bishops
item.description: The New and Returning Member Progress form helps the bishop and ward council know how to best assist individuals as they progress in the gospel.

item.title: Strengthening Priesthood Quorums
item.description: High councilors work with priesthood quorum and group leaders to activate and strengthen prospective elders and their families.

item.title: Member Missionary Work
item.description: Under the direction of their bishop, the ward mission leaders, ward council, and other members work with the full-time missionaries to grow the ward.

item.title: Anxiously Engaged: Acting in the Lord's Service
item.description: We do not need, nor should we wait for, an assignment to invite our nonmember family, friends, and neighbors to participate in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Priesthood Keys in Unity: A Discussion with Elder Neil L. Andersen
item.description: Mission presidents and stake presidents unite together and then work with other local leaders to bring people to the Savior’s gospel.

category.title: Special Broadcast: The Work of Salvation
category.subtitle: Videos: 13

item.title: The Work of Salvation
item.description: In this special broadcast, President Thomas S. Monson and members of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles share messages about how each of us can see ourselves in the work.

item.title: Hark, All Ye Nations!
item.description: A missionary choir from the Provo Missionary Training Center and local ward councils sings “Hark, All Ye Nations!”

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland

item.title: Church Councils in the Work of Salvation
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland

item.title: Missionary Work in the Digital Age
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry

item.title: I’ll Go Where You Want Me to Go
item.description: A video presentation portraying member missionary work.

item.title: Our Responsibility to Invite
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland

item.title: A Spiritual Work
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen

item.title: Missionary Song Medley
item.description: A video presentation portraying youth preparing to serve missions.

item.title: The Work of Salvation: Parable of a Father at Bedtime
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson

item.title: Teaching in the Church
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer

item.title: Faith in the Work of Salvation
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Called to Serve
item.description: A missionary choir from the Provo Missionary Training Center and local ward councils sings “Called to Serve.”

category.title: Ward Councils and Ward Mission Leaders
category.subtitle: Videos: 10

item.title: Preparing Families to Make Covenants
item.description: As ward council members and missionaries work in unity, they are successful in helping converts prepare to make covenants.

item.title: Helping Recent Converts Progress
item.description: An elders quorum president helps a new member grow in the gospel.

item.title: New and Returning Member Progress - Ward Councils
item.description: The steps on the New and Returning Member Progress form help the ward council assist new members.

item.title: United as Members and Missionaries
item.description: A unified ward fellowships the Clawson family as family members embrace the gospel.

item.title: Working Together: The Kane Family
item.description: Members and missionaries work together to help the Kane family return to church and to support the father as he makes the decision to be baptized.

item.title: Missionary Work in the Young Single Adult Committee
item.description: Missionary Work in the Young Single Adult Committee

item.title: Seek and Ye Shall Find
item.description: An assistant ward mission leader seeks inspiration for his role and invites investigators to be taught by the missionaries in members’ homes.

item.title: Serving in the Ward Mission
item.description: Under the direction of the bishop, the ward mission leader coordinates the work of the ward council and the full-time missionaries in the work of salvation.

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ
item.description: The role of a ward mission leader is crucial as he is the link between the ward council and the full-time missionaries.

item.title: The Ward Mission Leader in the Work of Salvation
item.description: A ward mission leader explains how his ward has been transformed by members who have become committed to missionary work and have extended invitations for friends and family to attend church or other activities.

item.title: Invite Diligent Learning
item.description: Leading inspired discussions results in meaningful participation in the classroom.

item.title: Love Those You Teach
item.description: Loving those you teach goes beyond what happens in the classroom.

item.title: Prepare and Teach by the Spirit
item.description: The best way to teach by the Spirit is to prepare by the Spirit, and that includes daily discipleship.

item.title: Teach the Doctrine
item.description: Teaching the doctrine clearly and powerfully helps build faith in Jesus Christ and bring about true conversion.

item.title: Welcome Teachers
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland gives insight and encouragement to newly called teachers of the Church.

item.title: Introduction to Teacher Council Meetings
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland provides an overview of what teacher council meetings are and why they are important.

item.title: Learn Together
item.description: What does it mean to learn together in a teacher council meeting? Here are some insights.

item.title: Practice And Invite
item.description: What does it mean to practice and invite during a teacher council meeting? Here is one perspective.

item.title: Share And Counsel Together
item.description: What does it mean to share and counsel in a teacher council meeting? Here is one experience.

item.title: Leading in the Savior’s Way
item.description: The Leadership Training Library contains resources for leaders to learn how to lead like the Savior.

item.title: Library Tutorial
item.description: Explore the Leadership Training Library.

item.title: Following the Handbook
item.description: President Monson encourages leaders to consult the handbooks regarding policies and procedures.

item.title: Learn, Teach, and Apply Handbook Principles
item.description: Elder Nelson explains the purpose of the Training Resource Library.

item.title: Teaching Leadership
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Teaching Leadership

item.title: Your Responsibility for Quorums
item.description: Members of the ward Young Men presidency act as advisers for quorum presidencies.

item.title: Sacred Keys of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Sacred Keys of the Aaronic Priesthood

item.title: The Keys of the Priesthood
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - The Keys of the Priesthood

item.title: Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 1
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 1

item.title: Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 2
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 2

item.title: Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 3
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 3

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: President Monson expresses appreciation to all members for their service in callings.

item.title: Preparation in the Priesthood
item.description: The Lord will assist and uplift leaders and make their weaknesses their strengths.

item.title: Providing in the Lord's Way
item.description: Priesthood and auxiliary leaders are responsible to coordinate and facilitate welfare assistance.

item.title: The Hearts of the Children Shall Turn
item.description: Priesthood and auxiliary leaders should encourage members to engage in family history work.

item.title: Teaching after the Manner of the Spirit
item.description: Effective gospel teaching helps people grow in their testimonies and faith of Jesus Christ and Heavenly Father.

item.title: Following the Spirit in the Ward Council
item.description: Ward leaders follow the Spirit to receive inspiration to carry out their callings and assignments in ward council.

item.title: New and Returning Member Progress
item.description: Ward council members help strengthen new and returning members in the ward.

item.title: He Shall Prepare a Way
item.description: By following the Spirit, ward council members are inspired to invite less-active members to return to the fold.

item.title: The One
item.description: Members are challenged to express their love to less-active members of the ward and invite them to return to the fold.

item.title: Standing Together in the Work of Salvation
item.description: Ward council members work together to rescue a family.

item.title: To the Rescue
item.description: President Monson explains each member’s duty to preach the gospel.

item.title: On the Lord's Errand
item.description: President Monson tells of the importance of each priest in his priests quorum when he was a young bishop.

item.title: Home Teaching: A Work of Love
item.description: Home teachers help members strengthen their faith and encourage them to keep covenants.

item.title: Organizing Home Teaching
item.description: Reporting home teaching is essential to understanding how to best serve individuals and families.

item.title: Reporting Home Teaching
item.description: Home teaching assignments are organized under the direction of the Priesthood to bless the lives of individuals and families.

item.title: Home Teaching: Encouraging Aaronic Priesthood Holders
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood holders can learn how to home teach from quorum advisers and by participating in home teaching with Melchizedek Priesthood holding partners.

item.title: Responsibilities of Visiting Teachers
item.description: Visiting teachers minister to their sisters as they fulfill the purposes of Relief Society to increase faith, strengthen families, and provide relief.

item.title: Organizing Visiting Teaching
item.description: Relief Society presidencies can organize visiting teaching successfully as they follow Handbook principles.

item.title: Assigning Visiting Teaching
item.description: Relief Society presidencies prayerfully consider visiting teaching assignments. As they receive and follow inspiration, miracles occur.

item.title: Reporting Visiting Teaching
item.description: Handbook 2 allows for visiting teaching reports to be received in a variety of ways. Reports focus on the needs of sisters and service rendered.

item.title: Visiting Teaching in the Work of Salvation
item.description: Visiting teachers can play a powerful role in helping sisters and their families progress toward eternal life.

item.title: A Model Home Teacher
item.description: President Monson describes how to be an effective home teacher.

item.title: Ministering to Spiritual Needs
item.description: Home teachers are charged with the responsibility to care for the spiritual needs of their assigned families.

item.description: The home is a sacred place to learn and teach gospel principles. This informal setting allows daily teaching moments and is focused on meeting the needs of individuals and families.

item.description: The Work of Salvation in the Ward and Stake 5.1

item.title: Prepare Spiritually
item.description: Bishops and auxiliary leaders of the Church need to prepare themselves spiritually each day.

item.title: The Spirit of Revelation
item.description: If leaders of the Relief Society prepare themselves spiritually, they will receive guidance to meet the needs of the sisters in the ward.

item.title: Seek, and Ye Shall Find
item.description: Assistant ward mission leaders should seek guidance from the Lord to know how to magnify their calling.

item.title: Teaching About Covenants
item.description: Strengthening a home means making and keeping sacred covenants, and teaching your children to do the same.

item.title: Daily Spiritual Preparation Long
item.description: Dedicating time daily for spiritual preparation will bring peace to our homes and prepare our families to meet life's challenges.

item.title: Family Councils
item.description: Meeting together in our homes to discuss needs, interests, and taking the time to listen to one another will strengthen familial bonds.

item.title: Participating in Councils
item.description: Ward councils are an opportunity for ward leaders to receive revelation.

item.title: Working Together in the Ward Council
item.description: Church leaders meet together in councils to work together and plan how to minister to the ward members’ needs.

item.title: Working Together in Service and Love
item.description: Christ knows how to minister to others perfectly. If we are His hands, should we not do the same?

item.title: Receiving Revelation as a Council
item.description: Councils can be a revelatory experience as we unite to discuss and address specific needs.

item.title: Seeking Revelation to Meet Needs
item.description: Through study, prayer, and planning, the Spirit will guide us in meeting the needs of others.

item.title: Ministering to Meet Needs
item.description: Ministering to others includes finding out their needs and showing Christlike love.

item.title: Minister to Others
item.description: Ministering to the needs of the ward members is the work of love.

item.title: Watching Over the One
item.description: A bishop persists in reactivating a youth in his ward, understanding the love of Jesus Christ for this young man.

item.title: The Errand of Angels
item.description: Relief Society sisters have the divine role of ministering to struggling ward members.

item.title: Ministering to Children (Worldwide Leadership Training)
item.description: The Primary presidency is to become familiar with children, strengthen children individually, and help children participate in Primary.

item.title: Training Future Leaders
item.description: See beyond the reality of a person to the possibilities that lie inside them.

item.title: The Power of Invitation
item.description: As we put our faith in the Lord, he will help us find those ready to accept the gospel.

item.title: Teach the Gospel
item.description: Elders quorum presidents and high priests group leaders are responsible for the gospel learning in their quorums and groups.

item.title: Principles of Teaching
item.description: Principles of Teaching

item.title: Serving in the Bishopric
item.description: The Church gives an explanation of the five basic duties of bishops as well as testimonies of real bishops.

item.title: A Faithful Disciple
item.description: Bishops need to prepare themselves spiritually each day.

item.title: Purposes of Sacrament Meeting
item.description: Sacrament meetings are the most sacred meetings in the Church, allowing members to renew covenants made at baptism.

category.title: Handbook 1, 2.2 President of the Aaronic Priesthood
category.subtitle: Videos: 2

item.title: Preparing Young Men for Missions
item.description: Bishops have a responsibility to prepare worthy, qualified members to serve as missionaries.

item.title: Directing Welfare Work
item.description: Bishops are responsible for administering and overseeing welfare assistance in the ward.

item.title: Presiding High Priest and Father of the Ward
item.description: President Monson discusses the roles, attributes, and impact of effective bishops.

item.title: On the Lord's Errand
item.description: President Monson tells of the importance of each priest in his priests quorum when he was a young bishop.

item.description: Priesthood holders labor to obtain the power of godliness found in that priesthood. They let it guide and transform everything they do.

item.description: Priesthood holders are standing ministers as they live among the people they serve and strive to meet their needs.

item.description: High priests group leaders work under the direction of the bishop to assist families in becoming self-reliant.

item.description: Quorum and group leaders have the responsibility to fellowship and assist prospective elders to prepare to receive the Melchizedek Priesthood and temple ordinances.

item.description: Elders quorum presidencies and high priests group leaders are responsible for gospel learning in their quorums and groups.

item.description: President Uchtdorf encourages priesthood brethren to lift where they stand and serve where they can.

item.description: President Packer teaches that the power of the priesthood lies within the family.

item.description: Out of love, a Deacon's quorum president in Arizona pushed himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.description: Through priesthood keys young men who hold the Aaronic Priesthood have unique, spiritual power.

item.description: Elder Ballard teaches bishops and other leaders how to inspire young men to desire to serve a mission.

item.description: Under the direction of the bishop, Relief Society presidents organize, teach, and inspire sisters to fulfill the purposes of the Relief Society.

item.description: Additional Relief Society meetings help sisters learn the charitable and practical responsibilities of the Relief Society.

item.description: Elder Ballard, Elder Rasband, Bishop Stevenson, Sister Wixom, Sister Burton, and Sister Dalton share an example of the power and influence a mother can have in the home.

item.description: A quote from President Joseph F. Smith outlines the divine roles and responsibilities of parents.

category.title: Featured Training: Learning and Teaching in the Home and Church
category.subtitle: Videos: 6

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Home
item.description: The home is a sacred place to learn and teach gospel principles. This informal setting allows daily teaching moments and is focused on meeting the needs of individuals and families.

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Church
item.description: Teaching in Church meetings and classes helps individuals and families learn the doctrine and take the principles into their homes. Effective teachers bear testimony and invite action.

item.title: Advancement in the Priesthood
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood 8.6

item.title: Helping Prospective Elders Progress
item.description: The Work of Salvation in the Ward and Stake 5.2

item.title: Inviting Others to Come unto Christ
item.description: Priesthood Principles 2.2

item.title: Preparing Families to Make Covenants
item.description: The Work of Salvation in the Ward and Stake 5.1

category.title: 10.2 Roles of Parents and Church Leaders
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Roles of Parents and Church Leaders
item.description: The bishopric and Young Women leaders support but do not replace parents in their responsibility over the physical and spiritual welfare of children.

item.title: Your Calling in Young Women
item.description: The Young Women presidency counsels together, teaches the gospel, and provides opportunities for young women to apply gospel principles.

item.title: Helping Young Women Live the Standards
item.description: Young Women leaders are called to help the young women learn to live the standards of the Church.

item.title: Sunday Gospel Instruction
item.description: Young Women leaders can improve Sunday lessons by preparing spiritually, focusing on needs, and helping young women apply the gospel in their lives.

item.title: Personal Progress
item.description: The Personal Progress program is designed to help young women gain testimonies and work toward making temple covenants.

item.title: Sugar Beets and the Worth of a Soul
item.description: President Monson describes how to reach out to less-active young women.

item.title: A Return to Virtue
item.description: Elaine S. Dalton explains virtue and challenges Church members to live virtuously.

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Home
item.description: The home is a sacred place to learn and teach gospel principles. This informal setting allows daily teaching moments and is focused on meeting the needs of individuals and families.

item.title: The Theme and Purposes of Primary
item.description: Primary leaders are called to ensure the purpose of Primary is fulfilled.

item.title: The Work of the Primary Presidency
item.description: The Primary presidency oversees the Primary program and assists parents in helping children gain testimonies.

item.title: Ministering to Children
item.description: The Primary presidency is to become familiar with children, strengthen children individually, and help children participate in Primary.

item.title: Working with the Secretary
item.description: Primary 11.2.3

item.title: Primary Sharing Time
item.description: Sharing time provides an opportunity for children to learn the gospel and feel the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Encouraging Reverence
item.description: Primary 11.8.4

item.title: Primary Leaders Minister to Teachers
item.description: Primary 11.2.2

item.title: Children with Disabilities
item.description: A Primary President works with her Bishopric to ensure that two special needs children have the best learning experience possible. Communicating with the parents helps her to understand the children's needs.

item.title: Children's Sacrament Meeting Presentation
item.description: Primary 11.5.4

item.title: Preparing Children for Baptism, Baptismal Services
The Model for an Effective Presidency
item.description: Elder Scott gives direction to stake presidents and bishops regarding calling and training new ward leaders.

item.title: Help Children Stay on the Path
item.description: Children should be taught the plan of salvation by word and example.

item.title: Serving in the Sunday School
item.description: Sunday School presidencies are responsible for the teaching, training, and support of ward members.

item.title: Ministering through the Ward Council
item.description: Sunday School - Ministering Through the Ward Council

item.title: Presidency Meetings
item.description: Sunday School presidencies meet together regularly in councils to discuss gospel learning needs within the ward.

category.title: 12.5 Improving Learning and Teaching in the Ward
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Improving Learning and Teaching in the Ward
item.description: Sunday School leaders assist other auxiliary leaders in developing and improving learning and teaching.

item.title: Examples of Righteousness
item.description: President Monson describes attributes of effective leaders.

item.title: A High Priority
item.description: In order for the gospel to be lived, it must be taught.

item.title: Serving in the Ward Mission
item.description: Ward mission leaders are responsible for coordinating member missionary efforts in the ward.

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ
item.description: The ward mission leader assists the bishop in coordinating missionary work in the ward.

item.title: The Ward Mission Plan
item.description: The ward mission plan is a simple document that outlines goals to help ward and auxiliary leaders participate in missionary work, retention, and activation.

item.title: Retention
item.description: Ward mission leaders are responsible for making sure new members have what they need to stay active in the Church.

item.title: To the Rescue
item.description: President Monson explains each member’s duty to preach the gospel.

item.title: Ask in Faith
item.description: Members are to pray for the courage to find investigators for the full-time missionaries to teach.

category.title: 16.2 Ministering to Young Single Adult Members
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Ministering to Young Single Adults
item.description: It is important for auxiliary leaders to reach out to young single adults and include them in the work of the Church.

item.title: Identify, Locate, and Shepherd Young Single Adults
item.description: Young single adult leaders are responsible for helping young single adults in finding and reactivating single adults.

item.title: Overview: The Young Single Adult Program
item.description: The young single adult program is designed to strengthen young single adults and provide opportunities for them to associate with each other.

item.title: The Importance of Institute
item.description: Elder Perry explains the history and importance of the Church's education program.

item.title: Preparing for Your Spiritual Destiny
item.description: Elder Andersen expresses the importance of losing yourself in the service of others.

category.title: Featured Training: Learning and Teaching in the Home and Church
category.subtitle: Videos: 6

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Home
item.description: The home is a sacred place to learn and teach gospel principles. This informal setting allows daily teaching moments and is focused on meeting the needs of individuals and families.

item.description: Priesthood Principles 2.2

item.title: Preparing Families to Make Covenants
item.description: The Work of Salvation in the Ward and Stake 5.1

item.title: Invite Diligent Learning
item.description: Leading inspired discussions results in meaningful participation in the classroom.

item.title: Love Those You Teach
item.description: Loving those you teach goes beyond what happens in the classroom.

item.title: Prepare and Teach by the Spirit
item.description: The best way to teach by the Spirit is to prepare by the Spirit, and that includes daily discipleship.

item.title: Teach the Doctrine
item.description: Teaching the doctrine clearly and powerfully helps build faith in Jesus Christ and bring about true conversion.

item.title: Welcome Teachers
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland gives insight and encouragement to newly called teachers of the Church.

item.title: Introduction to Teacher Council Meetings
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland provides an overview of what teacher council meetings are and why they are important.

item.title: Learn Together
item.description: What does it mean to learn together in a teacher council meeting? Here are some insights.

item.title: Practice And Invite
item.description: What does it mean to practice and invite during a teacher council meeting? Here is one perspective.

item.title: Share And Counsel Together
item.description: What does it mean to share and counsel in a teacher council meeting? Here is one experience.

item.title: February 2012 Worldwide Leadership Training
item.description: General Authorities counsel priesthood and auxiliary leaders on what we seek to do in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and the reason for it as well as how to accomplish the Church’s objectives.

item.title: The Doctrinal Importance of Marriage and Children
item.description: Elder Nelson discusses the doctrine that provides the reason for what we do in the Church and in our individual lives, particularly marriage, children, family, and the importance of priesthood power in the home.

item.title: Strengthening Quorums and Members
item.description: Elder Ballard leads a panel discussion on how the Church can assist in the ongoing conversion and well-being of its members, including strengthening priesthood quorums and other handbook directions.

item.title: The Gospel Answers Life’s Problems and Challenges
item.description: Elders Perry and Christofferson discuss how the restored gospel of Jesus Christ provides the answers to all of life’s challenges and how we can be more effective in making its principles and covenants bless our lives and the lives of others.

item.title: Acting on the Truths of the Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Uchtdorf counsels Church leaders on the importance of understanding inspired counsel and then acting on that counsel in order to build the kingdom of God.

item.title: Priesthood Power in the Home
item.description: President Packer discusses the importance and value of priesthood authority and leadership in the home and in the Church.

item.title: February 2011 Worldwide Leadership Training
item.description: General authorities teach and encourage leaders of the church to follow the spirit and obey prophetic counsel in their callings.

item.title: First Presidency Message
item.description: President Eyring encourages leaders to improve "the use of the scriptures, the words of living prophets and the handbooks provided to help us serve."

item.title: Overview
item.description: Elder Oaks reaffirms the teachings of the handbooks by repetition and further illustrations to yeild new understanding and renew commitment.

item.title: Introduction to Handbook 2 and Related Principles
item.description: Elder Cook clarifies key principles and important matters of Handbook 2.

item.title: Discussion on Priesthood Principles
item.description: Elder Bednar, Elder Christofferson, and Elder Holland discuss priesthood principles and the work of salvation in the ward and stake.

item.title: Uniformity and Adaptation
item.description: Elder Zwick speaks on uniformity and adaptation of the handbooks in wards and stakes throughout the world.

item.title: Prepare Spiritually
item.description: A panel of general authorities and general auxiliary members discuss examples of how priesthood and auxiliaries spiritualy prepare to make a difference in their wards and stakes.

item.title: Working with the Ward Council
item.description: A panel of general authorities and general auxiliary members discuss an example of working together in ward councils.

item.title: Sisters in Councils
item.description: Elder Scott invites women of the church around the world to participate and express their opinion in ward councils.

item.title: Ministering to Youth
item.description: General authorities and auxiliary leaders discuss the example of a bishop in Sheffield, England who keeps careful watch over one of his priests and brings him back into the fold.

item.title: Concluding Remarks
item.description: Elder Nelson states that "our objective is to strengthen the family and enhance the progress of each family toward the exalting ordinances and covenants of the holy temple."

item.title: 2010 Worldwide Leadership Training
item.description: General authorities teach principles from the new handbook in the November 2010 Worldwide Leadership Training.

item.title: Opening Remarks
item.description: President Monson introduces the new church handbook and encourages leaders to study and obey its teachings.

item.title: Overview of the New Handbooks
item.description: Elder Oaks explains the purpose, format, and content of the new church handbooks.

item.title: Selected Principles from the New Handbooks
item.description: Elder Cook explains the changes in councils to better focus on strengthening individuals and families in wards.

item.title: Ward Council Model
item.description: A ward council model takes place to show a proper meeting that encourages participation in planning for the needs of individuals in the ward.

item.title: Panel Discussion
item.description: General authorities and auxiliary members discuss ward councils, basic policies of the church, and use of the new handbook.

item.title: Concluding Remarks
item.description: President Packer testifies of the importance of reading, studying, and obeying the teachings found in the new handbook to strengthen the testimonies of members.
